H0.text: Epiphytes are plants that grow on other plants.

H1.text: Fungi are plants that grow on other plants.

H2.text: Parasites are plants that grow on other plants.

H3.text: Bryophytes are plants that grow on other plants.

A4.text: Epiphytes are plants or plant-like organisms that grow on the surface of another plant or plant-like organism such as kelp.

A5.text: Epiphytes differ from parasitic plants in that they grow on the host for physical support only, and do not draw nourishment from it.
